field.label: Enable BIND Daemon
field.help: This will activate the BIND daemon.

field.label: Disable IPv6
field.help: This will run BIND in IPv4-only mode.

field.label: Listen IPs
field.help: Set the IPv4 addresses the service should listen to.

field.label: Listen IPv6
field.help: Set the IPv6 addresses the service should listen to.

field.label: Listen Port
field.help: Set the port the service should listen to.

field.label: Query Source IP
field.help: Specify the IPv4 address used as a source for outbound queries.

field.label: Query Source IPv6
field.help: Specify the IPv6 address used as a source for outbound queries.

field.label: Transfer Source IP
field.help: Specify the IPv4 address used as a source for zone transfers.

field.label: Transfer Source IPv6
field.help: Specify the IPv6 address used as a source for zone transfers.

field.label: DNS Forwarders
field.help: Set one or more hosts to send your DNS queries if the request is unknown.

field.label: Enable filter-aaaa on IPv4 Clients
field.help: This will filter AAAA records on IPv4 Clients. Set "DNSSEC Validation" to "No" and AAAA records will be omitted even if they are signed.

field.label: Enable filter-aaaa on IPv6 Clients
field.help: This will filter AAAA records on IPv6 Clients. Set "DNSSEC Validation" to "No" and AAAA records will be omitted even if they are signed.

field.label: ACL for filter-aaaa
field.help: Specifies a list of client addresses for which AAAA filtering is to be applied.

field.label: Logsize in MB
field.help: Set the amount how big a logfile can growth. For Query and Blocked logs.

field.label: General Log level
field.help: Select General Log level. Log levels are listed in the order of increasing verbosity. Setting a certain log level will cause all messages of the specified and more severe log levels to be logged.

field.label: Maximum Cache Size
field.help: How much memory in percent the cache can use from the system. Default is 80%.

field.label: Recursion
field.help: Define an ACL where you allow which clients can resolve via this service. Usually use your local LAN.

field.label: Allow Transfer
field.help: Define the ACLs where you allow which server can retrieve zones.

field.label: Allow Query
field.help: Define the ACLs where you allow which client are allowed to query this server.

field.label: DNSSEC Validation
field.help: Default is "No". Set to "Auto" to use the static trust anchor configuration by the system.

field.label: Hide Hostname
field.help: This will hide the system hostname for DNS queries.

field.label: Hide Version
field.help: This will hide the local BIND version in DNS queries.

field.label: Disable Prefetching
field.help: This will disable prefetching of domains before they time out.

field.label: Enable Rate Limiting
field.help: This will enable rate-limiting for DNS responses.

field.label: Responses Per Second
field.help: Set how many non-empty responses are allowed per second for valid domain names and record types. The default is 0 or no limit.

field.label: Window
field.help: Set the number of second during which responses are tracked. The default is 15 seconds.

field.label: Exempt Clients
field.help: Exempt a list of IPs from rate-limiting, e.g. ::1

field.label: IPv4 Prefix Length
field.help: Set the number of bits of the address block. Used to distinquish clients into a rate-limited group. The default is 24.

field.label: IPv6 Prefix Length
field.help: Set the number of bits of the address block. Used to distinquish clients into a rate-limited group. The default is 56.

field.label: NODATA Responses Per Second
field.help: Set how many empty (NODATA) responses are allowed per second for valid domain names. The default is equal to the Responses Per Second value.

field.label: NXDOMAIN Responses Per Second
field.help: Set how many NXDOMAIN errors are allowed per second for undefined subdomains for valid domain names. The default is equal to the Responses Per Second value.

field.label: Referrals Per Second
field.help: Set how many referrals or delegations are allowed per second to a server for a given domain. The default is equal to the Responses Per Second value.

field.label: Errors Per Second
field.help: Set how many errors are allowed per second for valid domain names and record types. The default is equal to the Responses Per Second value.

field.label: All Per Second
field.help: Set how many UDP responses of all types are allowed per second. If used, this should be set to 4 times the size of other per second limits.

field.label: Slip
field.help: Set how often to "slip" responses, reducing the use of forged source addresses in attacks. The default is 2, i.e. every second response. Use a value of 0 to disable slipped responses. Use a value of 1 with caution.

field.label: QPS Scale
field.help: Set the ratio by which to scale back the Responses Per Second value during attacks. The formula used to produce the new value is ("QPS Scale"/Total Query Rate)*"Responses Per Second".

field.label: Maximum Table Size
field.help: Set the maximum number of table entries used to track requests and rate-limit responses. The default is 20,000.

field.label: Minimum Table Size
field.help: Set the minimum number of table entries used to track requests and rate-limit responses. The default is 500.

field.label: Trial Rate Limiting
field.help: Enable to test rate-limiting parameters without actually dropping any requests.

field.label: Algorithm
field.help: Set the authentication algorithm for the RNDC key. This requires a restart of the Bind Service.

field.label: Secret
field.help: The base64-encoded RNDC key. This requires a restart of the Bind Service.
